meanings.definition: The state or quality of being alive.
meanings.sent1: The livingnesses of the forest were evident in the chirping of birds and rustling of leaves.
meanings.sent2: The scientist studied the livingnesses of different organisms to understand their behaviors.
meanings.sent3: The livingnesses of the party were so vibrant that even the walls seemed to dance.
meanings.sent4: In the bustling city, the livingnesses of the streets never seemed to rest.
meanings.sent5: The livingnesses of the ocean could be felt in the crashing waves and teeming marine life.

meanings.sent1: The zookeeper ensured the livingnesses of the animals by providing proper care and nutrition.
meanings.sent2: The exploration of Mars raised questions about the possibility of livingnesses beyond Earth.
meanings.sent3: The livingnesses of the garden were so abundant that even the flowers seemed to smile.
meanings.sent4: In the vast universe, the livingnesses of distant planets remained a mystery.
meanings.sent5: The livingnesses of the rainforest were a symphony of sounds and colors.

meanings.definition: The characteristic of being living or alive.
meanings.sent1: The artist captured the livingnesses of the portrait with intricate details and vibrant colors.
meanings.sent2: The essence of livingnesses in nature inspired poets and painters throughout history.
meanings.sent3: The livingnesses of the old house seemed to whisper stories of the past to visitors.
meanings.sent4: In the quiet meadow, the livingnesses of the flowers swayed gently in the breeze.
meanings.sent5: The livingnesses of the forest enveloped the hikers in a sense of peace and wonder.
